comments:
DRIVER USED: TPTP-4.2.0-200606120100

Follow the instructions below to reproduce the problem:

- Make sure RAC is not running.  Start the workbench with a clean workspace
- Create a new *External Java Application* launch configuration and profile a simple class
- Once it has terminated, start the RAC.  Make sure RAC is started properly.
- Create a new *Java Application* launch configuration and profile a simple class

When this is done, I get the attached error message with the following exception:

java.lang.NullPointerException
null

java.lang.NullPointerException
  at org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.provisional.launcher.AbstractProcessLauncher.getClasspathString(AbstractProcessLauncher.java:221)
  at org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.provisional.launcher.AbstractProcessLauncher.preLaunch(AbstractProcessLauncher.java:101)
  at org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.provisional.launcher.PrimaryLaunchDelegate.run(PrimaryLaunchDelegate.java:244)
  at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:797)


I've marked this as critical, since it seems to be a serious usability issue and should be fixed for 4.2.
Added a new testcase for this to Platform.Execution.Framework.IAC-RAC-Coexistence.Windows/Linux
Can't reproduce problem with a slightly newer driver.
